title: State Manager configuration schema for database implementation
description: Configuration schema for State Manager's database implementation. Note that this configuration cannot be updated dynamically through the REST endpoint.

database.description: Connection parameters when using a database as the persistent storage

url.description: The JDBC URL to use by the state manager when using a database as the persistent storage

directory.description: The JDBC directory to use by the state manager when using a database as the persistent storage

driver.description: The JDBC driver to use by the state manager when using a database as the persistent storage

user.description: Admin username to use by the state manager when connecting to the database used as the persistent storage

pass.description: Admin password to use by the state manager when connecting to the database used as the persistent storage

pool.description: State Manager database pool connection properties

maxSize.description: Maximum connection pool size for State Manager DB

minSize.description: Minimum connection pool size for State Manager DB

idleTimeoutSeconds.description: Maximum time (in seconds) a connection can stay idle in the pool; A value of 0 means that idle connections are never removed from the pool

maxLifetimeSeconds.description: Maximum time (in seconds) a connection can stay in the pool, regardless if it has been idle or has been recently used; If a connection is in-use and has reached "maxLifetime" timeout, it will be removed from the pool only when it becomes idle

keepAliveTimeSeconds.description: Interval time (in seconds) in which connections will be tested for aliveness; Connections which are no longer alive are removed from the pool; A value of 0 means this check is disabled

validationTimeoutSeconds.description: Maximum time (in seconds) that the pool will wait for a connection to be validated as alive
